Class MovieManageSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • MovieManageSystem
  • public class MovieManageSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    This program demonstrates movie management system using object-oriented design principles. The program will read from database. The database contains information about the movies.
    Version:
    April 06, 2020
    Author:
    Jonghyun Park

      • MovieManageSystem

        public MovieManageSystem()

    • Method Detail

      • displayMenu

        public static void displayMenu()
        This method works for showing display screen and input options. Also, this method works for other methods.

      • addMovie

        public static void addMovie()
        The user will be prompted to enter the duration in minutes, title of the new movie, and the year the movie was released. When user add a new movie, the program should update the database by saving new movie at the end of the movie database.

      • retrieveMovieInYear

        public static void retrieveMovieInYear()
        The user will input a year and the program will display a list of all the movies released in that year along with the duration (in minutes) of all the movies. There is no need to specify a value for the ID column of a new movie record. This will be automatically set to the next available ID by the database.

      • retrieveRandomMovie

        public static void retrieveRandomMovie()
        The program will read from the supplied data file into a single array list. The database contains information about the movies. Each movie record has the following attributes: Duration (in minutes), Title, Year of release

      • deleteMovie

        public static void deleteMovie()
        This method lets the user delete a movie from the cprg251 database's movies table.

      • findAndDisplayId

        public static boolean findAndDisplayId​(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                       int deletedId)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        The findAndDisplayId method finds a specified movie's data and displays it.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for the database.
        deletedId - The deleted Id for the desired movie.
        Returns:
        true/false to indicate whether the movie was found
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - When there is an exception from the executeQuery method.

      • removeMovie

        public static void removeMovie​(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                               int deletedId)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        The removeMovie method deletes a specified movie.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for the database.
        deletedId - deletedId The deleted Id for the desired movie.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - hen there is an exception from the executeQuery method.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main method for connecting a MariaDB database using JDBC.
        Parameters:
        args -
